intro: Trachyspermum trichocarpum, commonly known as shivajirao's cumin, is an annual herbaceous plant native to India. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that develop into oval, hairy fruits. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their essential oils and volatile compounds. Trachyspermum trichocarpum thrives in warm, dry climates and is often cultivated for its aromatic properties.
